Question: What is the major output of the Define Scope process?
Which of the following is not an output of the Collect Requirements process?
Reviewing deliverables with the customer or sponsor to ensure that they are completed satisfactory and obtaining formal acceptance of deliverables is part of:
You friend has been assigned a project manager for a new project. Which document will guide the interactions between him and his selected vendors?
Note: [Qno: PML_152] >> Procurement management plan is your internal document as project manager. Contract is common document between you and vendor.

Question: Which of the following is an output of Verify Scope?
Anil is the project manager for a web interface development project. Which process he should use to ensure that the customer formally accepts the deliverables of each project phase?
As Project Manager how would you best avoid scope creep?
Note: [Qno: PML_207] >> Because of business need changes are inevitable part of today’s business. So neither we can stop them, nor dare to reject them. The best way is implement only approved changes.

Answers: Insist in defining the scope at the beginning of the project.
Insist that all change be approved.
Insist that all changes be made by a formal change request.
Do not accept any change Request in execution phase

Question: You are the project manager of a real estate project. The scope of the current project in hand is similar to your previous project done by you. Which of the following you might consider?
Note: [Qno: PML_214] >> Reusing WBS helps you knowing the list of deliverables. Other inputs mentioned cannot be used because this is different project.

Answers: Use the previous project’s WBS as a template.
Use the previous project’s product description when writing the scope statement.
Use the previous project’s schedule as a template.
Use the previous project’s cost-benefit analysis as justification for this project.

Question: The process of defining and documenting stakeholders’ needs to meet the project objectives is called?
The HR manager write you an email and in that he asks you to a change the calculation method of a field on screen. This is considered as what of the following?
Note: [Qno: PML_257] >> 1 is not true. Because this is not routine activity that he does.

Question: The Work Breakdown Structure is:

Answers: a product oriented structure which shows the component elements necessary to produce the project deliverables.
an assignment oriented structure which shows which individuals are responsible for each of the project deliverables.
an activity oriented structure which shows which work components have been assigned to which organizational unit.
a deliverable oriented structure that organizes and defines the total scope of the project.

Question: You collected feedback from a group of experts. But the responses are only available to the facilitator to maintain anonymity. Which technique are you using?
Which of the following is not included into product analysis?
Note: [Qno: PML_278] >> Earn value tool-technique is part of Cost Control.

Question: The features and functions that characterize a product, service, or result are called?
Grouping of project elements that organizes and defines the total scope of the project is called WBS. WBS can be -----
Brainstorming and lateral thinking are -----

Answers: Organizational process assets that are used to help develop the project management plan.
Alternatives identification technique, which is a tool and technique of the estimate activity duration process.
Expert judgment tool used to develop the project scope statement.
Alternatives identification technique, which is a tool and technique of the define scope process.

Question: Project scope completion is measured against …
Note: [Qno: PML_316] >> RTM is used to trace requirement, not for checking scope completion. Product and project scope both are important.

Question: A baseline which contains the user acceptance criteria, work packages, and a dictionary. Which baseline is this?

In a meeting with stakeholders you are verifying that all items currently in the scope are really necessary or if functions could be provided at a lower cost without degrading performance or quality of the deliverables. Which product analysis are you using?
Which of the following best describes the difference between project deliverables and project requirements?

Answers: Deliverables are specific items that must be produced to consider the project or project phase complete. A phase can have one deliverable and many requirements.
Requirements are measurable items that must be produced to consider the project or project phase complete. A phase can have multiple deliverable and many requirements.
Requirements are measurable items that must be produced to consider the project or project phase complete. Deliverables are the specifications of the product, services or result need to be delivered.

Deliverables are specific items that must be produced to consider the project or project phase complete. Requirements are the specifications of the deliverables used to tell you if the deliverables were produced successfully.

Question: Within one week of project scope statement baseline customer comes to and mentions that frozen requirements does not support our newly changed marketing strategy therefore contract need to be amended. After this change is evaluated and you found substantial change in cost and schedule which has been approved by customer. What is your next step?

Answers: Cost and Schedule has been approved by the customer therefore do nothing
Adjust your baselines as per newly approved cost and schedule.

Question: Sponsor decided that although all will participate to give input but only Jim will make the decision. Which decision making technique is this?
A discipline deals with interdisciplinary field of engineering that focuses on how complex engineering projects should be designed and managed over the life cycle of the project.
The Scope baseline consists of

Answers: Cost baseline, Quality baseline and Schedule baseline
Scope statement, WBS, and WBS dictionary
Configuration management plan and Configuration identification document
Procurement statement of work and Project scope statement

Question: Your customer expects you to implement a minor scope change without delay and without additional cost. You believe that you have adequate authorization to make the decision by yourself, but you are not quite sure about this. What should be your next steps

Answers: Handle the request according to the integrated change control processes described in your management plans. Then make a decision together with the appropriate change control body, whether the increased customer satisfaction will be worth the extra costs, work, risks etc.

Customer satisfaction is your top priority. Customer gives you opportunity for this. This is the opportunity to exceed the expectations. So ahead and make up the cost from contingency buffer. After all this is for these kind of situations.
Look into the opportunity and try to exploit it for further profit maximization
This is good opportunity to develop relations so go ahead and start working on this, after all this is minor scope change.

Question: A WBS dictionary has

Answers: List of deliverables & their dictionary meaning

Question: Where should you write the product acceptance criteria?
The Scope baseline includes____.

Answers: Details of scope management plans of the project
Configuration Management Plan and Statement of work

Question: What is the meaning of the acronym CSOW?

Answers: Statement of work - part of contingency plan
Currently valid statement of work, which should be used for comparison with other versions of SOW
Statement of work that is directly linked to Control account
Formally agreed statement of work part of the contract

Question: A difference between a Statement of work and a Scope statement is:

Answers: The statement of work focuses on physical or technical matters, while the project scope statement focuses on a functional view.
The statement of work is prepared by the customer while the scope statement is developed by the project management team.
The project scope statement is in most projects developed before the statement of work is written.
A project scope statement can become a contract document; a statement of work cannot.

Question: Which of the following is not true about the WBS report?
Note: [Qno: PML_720] >> WBS should focus on deliverables.

Answers: The project team must be involved in developing the WBS.
As a rule of thumb, each activity of WBS should take less than 80 hours.
WBS should focus in on the activities that must be performed in the project and should not focus on the deliverables.
WBS is usually represented in a hierarchical fashion.

Question: Which of the following is true regarding Control Account?

Answers: It is the body with overall administrative authority and control over an account in the performing organization
It is a quality control tool for controlling the defects to minimize delivered defects
It is the major accounting book where all the cost details are entered for an active account
It is a management control point where scope, budget, actual cost and schedule are integrated and compared to earned value for performance management

Question: Create WBS is part which Knowledge Area?
Which of the following statement is NOT true?
Note: [Qno: PML_1127] >> WBS, WBS Dictionary, Scope baseline & Project document updates are output of Create WBS process

Answers: Work breakdown structure(updates) is an output of Scope control
WBS Dictionary is an output of Define Scope
Requested changes is an output of Scope Verification
Work Performance information is an input to Scope control

Question: Amit is the manager of a software project. His client has agreed on a Project Scope Statement at the beginning of the project, but whenever the client verifies deliverables, he comes up with features that he would like to add into the product. Amit is working with the client to find what requirements were missed in the planning stages of the project and how to plan better in the future. This is an example of
Note: [Qno: PML_1295] >> The project’s scope is changing every time the client is asked to verify the product—that’s scope creep.

Question: Who creates the scope baseline?
Note: [Qno: PML_1347] >> Stakeholders can give input but scope baseline should be created by Project Team.

Question: Which of the following options is not used for assessing the completion of the project scope.
Note: [Qno: PML_1754] >> The product requirements are the basis for assessing the completion of the PRODUCT scope. Remaining all are used to verify the project scope.

Question: All of the following are true concerning the product description except
Note: [Qno: PML_1772] >> The product description is generally broader that a statement of work. [12.1.1.2]

Answers: It describes the ultimate end product of the project.
It provides important information about any technical issues that are relevant to procurement planning.
It is another term for the Statement of Work (SOW).
It is usually part of the Request for Proposal.

Question: Project success depends on a no. of interrelated factors, including time, cost and scope control. The success of any project depends primarily on:

Answers: Customer experience in providing detail scope
Exceeding customer expectations through gold plating.

This is example of Delphi technique

Question: Which one tool and technique required while you are collecting requirement as well as when defining scope?
What is 100% rule?

Assign 100% complete to any work only after verified by the customer
It rarely works in project because it expect that project manager should deliver 100% of the feature without any extra cost.
Do not create any talk of more than 8 hours in your plan and assign 100% as soon as activity starts

Each control account may include one or more work packages
Each work package must be associated with only one control account
Control accounts are directly related to charted accountant

Which is not part of product analysis
